inventory.commentary: includes TRY FOR and TRY OUT

sense.name: attempt, make an effort
sense.commentary: NP1[+agent] TRY[-complete] NP/SCOMP{+goal] Note: 'try' by itself never implies the goal was attained.
sense.examples: The outfielder tried to catch the fly ball. They are trying to buy out that company. He will definitely try for the gold. Mary tried out for the musical but they didn't cast her.

sense.name: test, experiment, sample
sense.commentary: NP1[+agent] TRY NP2[+object] includes TRY ON and TRY OUT
sense.examples: This drug hasn't been tried on humans yet. Would you like to try my soup? John tried several techniques of applying the paint. She tried on six pairs of shoes. I'd like to try out that new Mercedes. It's a new approach that hasn't been tried out before. We are going to try out the new French restaurant.

sense.name: put on trial
sense.examples: You cannot be tried twice for the same crime. They will try this case in New Jersey.

sense.name: strain, burden, cause to suffer
sense.examples: Mary was tried by the baby's constant crying. These are times that try men's souls.

sense.name: melt or render
sense.examples: You must first try the butter, then add it to the batter.
